definition: body weary, strength exhausted (idiom); extremely tired/spent
muscle/tendon/veins visible under the skin/sth resembling tendons or veins (e.g. fiber in a vegetable)
weary
power/force/strength/ability/strenuously
surname Li
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely

sentences.english: The long-distance runner was dead beat as he crossed the finishing line.
sentences.chinese: 長跑運動員在衝過終點線時已筋疲力盡。

sentences.english: I am tuckered out from eating.
He got into my boat and I rowed out a little way.
sentences.chinese: 他上了我的船，使我劃得有點筋疲力盡。

sentences.english: Perhaps you can obtain more discharge in the website that is your with dog-tired .
sentences.chinese: 也許你在爲自己的網站能獲得更多流量以筋疲力盡。

sentences.english: Lauren asked a bone-tired volunteer. The man shook his head.
sentences.chinese: 勞倫斯問一個累得筋疲力盡的自願者，那人搖了搖頭。

sentences.english: I am tuckered out from laughing.
They were beaten.  Some were killed.
sentences.chinese: 他們筋疲力盡，有的還遇難了。

sentences.english: Because of gravity, long flight would be exhausted.
sentences.chinese: 由於地心吸力，長途飛行會感到筋疲力盡。

sentences.english: You climb the mountain in an equilibrium between restlessness and exhaustion.
sentences.chinese: 你爬山就是在焦躁不安和筋疲力盡之間找一個平衡。

sentences.english: A: I don’t like climbing. I’m always worn out after climbing.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜歡爬山，爬完山後我總是覺得筋疲力盡的。

sentences.english: With a sigh he bowed and picked ip up with his spent hand.
sentences.chinese: 嘆了一口氣，他彎下腰來用筋疲力盡的手揀起了它。

sentences.english: As a result of a day's outdoor work, I have burnt myself out.
sentences.chinese: 在戶外工作了一整天，因此我已筋疲力盡。

sentences.english: He arrived at Shelly Hot Springs, tired and dusty, on Sunday night.
sentences.chinese: 星期天晚上他筋疲力盡滿身髒污地到達了雪莉溫泉。

sentences.english: My strength gave out after climbing up to the tenth floor.
sentences.chinese: 爬上十層樓後，我筋疲力盡了。

definition: at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
hanging one's head dispiritedly (idiom); dejected/crestfallen
trapeze artist/frequent flyer
the still of the night (idiom)/late at night
to force someone to do something
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
grove
to be unable to breathe
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
lit. dumb as a wooden chicken (idiom); fig. dumbstruck
variant of 紓壓|纾压[shu1 ya1]
red in the face/extremely angry
depressed/sulky/moody/unhappy
dull/insipid
to damn/to curse/to revile
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
